title: Aylestone Meadows Walking Route

images.title: Mat Fascione / New pathways on the Aylestone Meadows
images.caption: New pathways on the Aylestone Meadows. Looking northeast from the Middleton Street entrance. These paths were constructed during the winter and spring of 2008.

images.title: Mat Fascione / Footbridge on the Aylestone Meadows
images.caption: Footbridge on the Aylestone Meadows. This bridge carries a path that links the Great Central Way and the Canal Street car park.

images.title: Kings Lock - Grand Union Canal by Ashley Dace, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Kings Lock

description: This easy walk visits Leicester's largest local nature reserve. It's a fine place for a walk with trails along the River Soar and the Grand Union Canal Walk. There's nice footpaths and raised boardwalks to follow around this urban oasis where you can see horses grazing and a variety of birds around the water. There's also lots of interesting plants and a medieval packhorse bridge to see. You can start the walk from the car park at the northern end of the site, off Braunstone Lane East.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The reserve is a popular place for dog walkers so you'll probably see other owners on your visit.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Head north and you could pick up the River Soar Walk and visit the lovely Watermead Country Park where there are a series of lakes to explore. Just to the south there's Everards Meadows where there's a popular cycle route and more nice walking trails. The site also includes a cafe and cycle hire centre. If you head east towards Oadby and Wigston there's a pleasant community orchard and pretty meadows to explore at Brocks Hill Country Park. For more walking ideas in the area see the Leicestershire Walks page.

display_address: Braunstone Lane East, Aylestone, Leicester, City of Leicester, England, LE3 2DF, United Kingdom
